WRITING.TITLE: Sophisticated Trump

WRITING.TEXT: I'm a huge extrovert but what you said perfectly describes my girlfriend. My friends don't understand it but when it's just me and her she's really relaxed and funny, she can be herself. However around 20 people she only slightly knows she goes quiet and they think she's rude or boring. The really good friends have taken the time to wait and chat to her, which means she can relax and be funny but sadly the majority don't get it and judge her for being quiet. I find it really annoying but if anything it separated my good friends from my acquaintances.
In my opinion one of the funniest (if not THE funniest) line from the Star Wars Specials. Cracked me up first time I heard it. That and Admiral Akbar saying "Big mistakey?"

WRITING.TITLE: Help me identify a game
WRITING.TEXT:
I played an online game a few weeks back that I found on here and I can't remember the name of it and it's driving me up the wall. It was a game you play in your web browser, you control a small ball and move it around the map trying to swallow up smaller balls, making your ball larger as you do. It's an online multiplayer as others are trying to do the same on the map. If someone bigger than you swallowed you up then you died.
It was really addictive but as you can imagine that's a difficult thing to google without it sounding like you're looking for some kind of porn.
Please help.

George Osborne Loves N.W.A. - Have I Got News For You

WRITING.TEXT:
I know this may not be a popular opinion but I just don't get it with Halo anymore. I absolutely loved the first one and played it endlessly, Halo 2 was great and I felt improved on the franchise. Halo 3 never lived up to the hype for me, the 'Believe' diorama looked like it would end with an all out war with loads of NPC's battling it out but it never felt like I got the end the adverts promised. I completed 4 but I honestly couldn't tell you a thing about it, it just never drew me in and the now 5 just doesn't hold anything for me. I tried re-visiting 4 and even the gameplay didn't feel that great anymore. Then again I never played Reach, or ODST or any of the spin offs so maybe I'm missing the greater lore but to be honest I don't think I care enough anymore to learn about it.
Then again maybe I'm just a moaning old man letting nostalgia weigh my decision and I'm talking shit.
Just what I was thinking

WRITING.TITLE: Testing The Kia Optima On The Nurburgring - Fifth Gear

WRITING.TEXT: Your mortgage is $750 per month?! Where do you live? I live in London and my rent is 380 a week, which works out at roughly $2518 a month and that's for a small one bed flat. I share the burden with my SO, meaning it's $1259 each, making it a little easier but it's still a lot. I'm not trying to brag or show off, I'm just amazed/jealous that mortgages are so low in the US.
